title: Aldi To Open 130 New UK Stores And Hire 8,000
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Aug 6, 2015, 05:17 BST - UK Markets open in 2 hrs 43 mins Aldi To Open 130 New UK Stores And Hire 8,000 By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 2 hours 6 minutes ago View Photo 

Discount supermarket Aldi is hiring 8,000 more staff and opening 130 new stores as part of a £600m expansion in the UK. 
The supermarket is aiming to increase its UK workforce to 35,000, in the two-year planned investment. 
Aldi has grown from strength to strength in recent years. 
In April it overtook Waitrose as the UK's sixth-biggest supermarket, with 5.3% of the market share. 
Aldi has also launched its campaign as an official Team GB partner with a year to go until the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. 
As part of the partnership, the supermarket has recruited six Team GB athletes including Nicola Adams, the world's first female boxing Olympic champion. 
Tony Baines, joint managing director of corporate buying, said: "Since we opened our doors in the UK in April 1990, we've worked hard to establish British roots, sourcing locally where possible and building long-term relationships with British suppliers. 
"The partnership with Team GB celebrates this and epitomises the spirit of teamwork that is at the heart of how we give customers what they want and respect what matters most to them."
